entry.title: 第9章 云管理机制
entry.content:
第9章 云管理机制

远程管理系统

定义

  • 远程管理系统机制向外部云资源管理者提供工具和用户界面来配置和管理基于云的 IT 资源。
  • The remote administration system mechanism provides tools and user-interfaces for external cloud resource administrators to configure and administer cloud-based IT resources.

功能

  • 远程管理系统能够建立一个入口以便访问各种底层系统的控制与管理功能。
  • The remote administration system can establish a portal for access to administration and management features of various underlying systems.

入口类型

  • 远程管理系统提供的工具和 API 一般被云提供者用来开发和定制在线入口，这些入口向云用户提供各种管理控制。
  • The tools and APIs provided by a remote administration system are generally used by the cloud provider to develop and customize online portals that provide cloud consumers with a variety of administrative controls.
  1. 使用与管理入口（Usage And Administration Portal）
    • 一种通用入口，集中管理不同的基于云的 IT 资源，并提供 IT 资源使用报告。
    • A general purpose portal that centralizes management controls to different cloud-based IT resources and can further provide IT resource usage reports.
  2. 自助服务入口（Self-Service Portal）
    • 该入口本质上是一个购买门户，它允许云用户搜索云提供者提供的最新云服务和 IT 资源（通常是租赁的）列表。然后云用户向云提供者提交其选项进行资源调配。
    • This is essentially a shopping portal that allows cloud consumers to search an up-to-date list of cloud services and IT resources that are available from a cloud provider (usually for lease). The cloud consumer submits its chosen items to the cloud provider for provisioning.

可执行的任务

  • 配置与建立云服务 configuring and setting up cloud services
  • 为按需云服务提供和释放 IT 资源 provisioning and releasing IT resource for on-demand cloud services
  • 监控云服务的状态、使用和性能 monitoring cloud service status, usage, and performance
  • 监控 QoS 和 SLA 的实行 monitoring QoS and SLA fulfillment
  • 管理租赁成本与使用费用 managing leasing costs and usage fees
  • 管理用户账户、安全凭证、授权和访问控制 managing user accounts, security credentials, authorization, and access control
  • 跟踪对租赁服务内部与外部的访问 tracking internal and external access to leased services
  • 规划与评估 IT 资源供给 planning and assessing IT resource provisioning
  • 容量规划 capacity planning

资源管理系统

定义

  • 资源管理系统机制帮助协调 IT 资源，以便响应云用户和云提供者执行的管理操作。
  • The resource management system mechanism helps coordinate IT resources in response to management actions performed by both cloud consumers and cloud providers

组成

  • 资源管理系统包含一个 VIM 平台和一个虚拟机映像库。VIM 也可能有额外的库，包括专门用来存放操作数据的。
  • A resource management system encompassing a VIM platform and a virtual machine image repository. The VIM may have additional repositories, including one dedicated to storing operational data.

可执行的任务

  • 管理用来创建预构建实例的虚拟 IT 资源模板 managing virtual IT resource templates that are used to create pre-built instances
  • 分配和释放虚拟 IT 资源 allocating and releasing virtual IT resource
  • 协调 IT 资源 coordinating IT resources
  • 在云服务实例的生命周期内，强制执行使用策略与安全规定 enforcing usage and security policies throughout the lifecycle of cloud service instances
  • 监控 IT 资源的操作条件 monitoring operational conditions of IT resources

工作流程

SLA 管理系统

定义

  • SLA 管理系统机制代表的是一系列商品化的可用云管理产品，这些产品提供的功能包括：SLA 数据的管理、收集、存储、报告以及运行时通知。
  • The SLA management system mechanism represents a range of commercially available cloud management products that provide features pertaining to the administration, collection, storage, reporting, and runtime notification of SLA data.

工作流程

计费管理系统

定义

  • 计费管理系统机制专门用于收集和处理使用数据，它涉及云提供者的结算和云用户的计费。
  • The billing management system mechanism is dedicated to the collection and processing of usage data as it pertains to cloud provider accounting and cloud consumer billing.

不同定价规则

  • 定价模型可以是传统的按使用付费模式，也可以是固定费率或按分配付费模式，还可以是它们的组合。
  • Pricing models can vary from the traditional pay-per-use models, to flat-rate or pay-per-allocation modes, or combinations thereof.
  • 计费是根据使用前支付和使用后支付来安排的。后者支付类型又分为预定义限值和无限制使用。
  • Billing arrangements be based on pre-usage and post-usage payments. The later type can include pre-defined limits or unlimited usage.

工作流程

entry.title: 第11章 基本云架构
entry.content:
第11章 基本云架构

负载分布架构

定义

  • 负载分布架构（Workload Distribution Architecture）通过增加一个或多个相同的 IT 资源可用进行 IT 资源水平扩展，而提供运行时逻辑的负载均衡器能够在可用的 IT 资源上均匀分配工作负载。
  • IT resources can be horizontally scaled via the addition of one or more identical IT resources, and a load balancer that provides runtime logic capable of evenly distributing the workload among the available IT resources.

核心机制

负载均衡器 Load Balancer

  • 在一定程度上依靠复杂的负载均衡算法和运行时逻辑，减少 IT 资源的过度使用和使用率不足的情况。
  • reduces both IT resource over-utilization and under-utilization dependent upon the sophistication of the load balancing algorithms and runtime logic.
  • 这种基本架构模型可以应用于任何 IT 资源。负载分布常常可以用来支持分布式虚拟服务器、云存储设备和云服务。
  • This fundamental architectural model can be applied to any IT resource. Workload distribution commonly carried out in support of distributed virtual servers, cloud storage devices, and cloud services.

特殊变化

结合负载均衡的各个方面，应用于特殊 IT 资源的负载均衡系统通常会形成这种架构的特殊变化：

  • 服务负载均衡架构 the service load balancing architecture
  • 负载均衡的虚拟服务器架构 the load balanced virtual server architecture
  • 负载均衡的虚拟交换机架构 the load balanced virtual switches architecture

其他机制

  • 审核监控器 Audit Monitor
  • 云使用监控器 Cloud Usage Monitor
  • 虚拟机监控器 Hypervisor
  • 逻辑网络边界 Logical Network Perimeter
  • 资源集群 Resource Cluster
  • 资源复制 Resource Replication

资源池架构

定义

  • 资源池架构（Resource Pooling Architecture）以使用一个或者多个资源池为基础，其中相同的 IT 资源由一个系统进行分组和维护，以自动确保它们保持同步。
  • A resource pooling architecture is based on the use of one or more resource pools, in which identical IT resources are grouped and maintained by a system that automatically ensures that they remain synchronized.

常见的资源池

  • 物理服务器池

  • 虚拟服务器池

  • 存储池

  • 网络池

  • CPU 池

  • 内存池

资源池集合

  • 可以将单个的池集合为一个更大的池，在这个更大的资源池中，每个单独的池成为了子资源池。

同级资源池（用户相互隔离）

嵌套资源池（IT 资源类型相同，数量可不同）

其他机制

  • 审核监控器 Audit Monitor
  • 云使用监控器 Cloud Usage Monitor
  • 虚拟机监控器 Hypervisor
  • 逻辑网络边界 Logical Network Perimeter
  • 按使用付费监控器 Pay-Per-Use Monitor
  • 远程管理系统 Remote Administration System
  • 资源管理系统 Resource Management Ststem
  • 资源复制 Resource Replication

动态可扩展架构

定义

  • 动态可扩展架构（Dynamic Scalability Architecture）是一个架构模型，它基于预先定义扩展条件的系统，触发这些条件会导致从资源池中动态分配 IT 资源。
  • The dynamic scalability architecture is an architectural model based on a system of predefined scaling conditions that trigger the dynamic allocation of IT resources from resource pools.

核心机制

自动扩展监听器 Automated Scaling Listener

  • 自动扩展监听器配置了负载阈值，以决定何时为工作负载的处理添加新 IT 资源。
  • The automated scaling listener is configured with workload thresholds that dictate when new IT resources need to be added to the workload processing.
  • 动态可扩展架构可以应用于一系列 IT 资源，包括虚拟服务器和云存储设备。
  • The dynamic scalability architecture can be applied to a range of IT resources, including virtual servers and cloud storage devices.

资源复制 Resource Replication

常用的动态扩展类型

  • 动态水平扩展（Dynamic Horizontal Scaling）
    • 向内或向外扩展 IT 资源实例，以便处理工作负载的变化。
    • IT resource instances are scaled out and in to handle fluctuating workloads.
  • 动态垂直扩展（Dynamic Vertical Scaling）
    • 当需要调整单个 IT 资源的处理容量时，向上或向下扩展 IT 资源实例。
    • IT resource instances are scaled up and down when there is a need to adjust the processing capacity of a single IT resource.
  • 动态重定位（Dynamic Relocation）
    • 将 IT 资源重放置到更大容量的主机上。
    • The IT resource is relocated to a host with more capacity.

动态水平扩展的过程

  1. 监听

    ① Cloud service consumers are sending requests to a cloud service.

    ② The automated scaling listener monitors the cloud service to determine if predefined capacity thresholds are being exceeded.

  2. 判断

    ③ The number of requests coming from cloud service consumers increases.

    ④ The workload exceeds the performance thresholds. The automated scaling listener determines the next course of action based on a predefined scaling policy.

    ⑤ If the cloud service implementation is deemed eligible for additional scaling, the automated scaling listener initiates the scaling process.

  3. 报告

    ⑥ The automated scaling listener sends a signal to the resource replication mechanism.

    ⑦ which creates more instances of the cloud service.

    ⑧ Now that the increased workload has been accommodated, the automated scaling listener resumes monitoring and detracting and adding IT resources, as required.

其他机制

  • 云使用监控器 Cloud Usage Monitor
  • 虚拟机监控器 Hypervisor
  • 按使用付费监控器 Pay-Per-Use Monitor

弹性资源容量架构

定义

  • 弹性资源容量架构（Elastic Resource Capacity Architecture）主要与虚拟服务器的动态供给相关，利用分配和回收 CPU 与 RAM 资源的系统，立即响应托管 IT 资源的处理请求变化。
  • The elastic resource capacity architecture is primarily related to the dynamic provisioning of virtual servers, using a system that allocates and reclaims CPUs and RAM in immediate response to the fluctuating processing requirements of hosted IT resources

核心机制

自动扩展监听器 Automated Scaling Listener

  1. 监听

    ① Cloud service consumers are actively sending requests to a cloud service,

    ② which are monitored by an automated scaling listener.

    ③ An intelligent automation engine script is deployed with workflow logic

    ④ that is capable of notifying the resource pool using allocation requests.

  2. 报告

    ⑤ Cloud service consumer requests increase,

    ⑥ causing the automated scaling listener to signal the intelligent automation engine to execute the script.

    ⑦ The script runs the workflow logic that signals the hypervisor to allocate more IT resources from the resource pools.

    ⑧ The hypervisor allocates additional CPU and RAM to the virtual server, enabling the increased workload to be handled.

其他机制

  • 云使用监控器 Cloud Usage Monitor
  • 按使用付费监控器 Pay-Per-Use Monitor
  • 资源复制 Resource Replication

服务负载均衡架构

定义

  • 服务负载均衡架构（Service Load Balancing Architecture）可以被认为是负载分布架构的一个特殊变种，它是专门针对扩展云服务实现的。
  • The service load balancing architecture can be considered a specialized variation of the workload distribution architecture that is geared specifically for scaling cloud service implementations.

核心机制

负载均衡器 Load Balancer

  • 云服务实现的副本被组织为一个资源池，而负载均衡器则作为外部或内置组件（下图1），允许托管服务器自行平衡工作负载。
  • The duplicate cloud service implementations are organized into a resource pool, while the load balancer is positioned as either an external or built-in component to allow the host servers to balance the workloads themselves.
  • 负载均衡器在位置上可以独立于云设备及其主机服务器（下图2），也可以成为应用程序或服务器环境的内置组件。
  • The load balancer can be positioned either independent of the cloud services and their host servers, or built-in as part of the application or server’s environment.

其他机制

  • 云使用监控器 Cloud Usage Monitor
  • 资源集群 Resource Cluster
  • 资源复制 Resource Replication

云爆发架构

定义

  • 云爆发架构（Cloud Bursting Architecture）建立了一种动态扩展的形式，只要达到预先设置的容量阈值，就从企业内部的 IT 资源扩展或“爆发”到云中。
  • The cloud bursting architecture establishes a form of dynamic scaling that scales or “bursts out” on-premise IT resources into a cloud whenever predefined capacity thresholds have been reached.

核心机制

自动扩展监听器 Automated Scaling Listener

  • 自动扩展监听器决定何时将请求重定向到基于云的 IT 资源。
  • The automated scaling listener determines when to redirect requests to cloud-based IT resources.

资源复制 Resource Replication

  • 资源复制机制维持企业内部和基于云的 IT 资源之间的状态信息的同步。
  • Resource replication is used to maintain synchronicity between on-premise and cloud-based IT resources in relation to state information.

弹性磁盘供给架构

定义

  • 弹性磁盘供给架构（Elastic Disk Provisioning Architecture）建立了一个动态存储供给系统，它确保按照云用户实际使用的存储量进行精确计费。
  • The elastic disk provisioning architecture establishes a dynamic storage provisioning system that ensures that the cloud consumer is granularly billed for the exact amount of storage that it actually uses.
  • 该系统采用自动精简供给技术实现存储空间的自动分配，并进一步支持运行时使用监控来收集准确的使用数据以便计费。
  • This system uses thin-provisioning technology for the dynamic allocation of storage space, and is further supported by runtime usage monitoring to collect accurate usage data for billing purposes.

冗余存储架构

定义

  • 冗余存储架构（Redundant Storage Architecture）引入了复制的辅云存储设备作为故障系统的一部分，它要与主云存储设备中的数据保持同步。
  • The redundant storage architecture introduces a secondary duplicate cloud storage device as part of a failover system that synchronizes its data with the data in the primary cloud storage device.

核心机制

逻辑单元号 Logical Unit Number（LUN）

  • 逻辑单元号（LUN）是一个逻辑驱动器，它代表物理服务驱动器的一个分区。
  • A logical unit number (LUN) is a logical drive that represents a partition of a physical drive.

存储设备网关 Storage Service Gateway

  • 当主设备失败时,存储服务网关将云消费请求向次要设备转移。
  • A storage service gateway diverts cloud consumer requests to the secondary device whenever the primary device fails.
  • 存储设备网关是一个组件，是连接到云存储设备的外部接口。
  • The storage service gateway is a component that acts as the external interface to cloud storage services.

entry.title: 第4章 基本概念与模型
entry.content:
# 第4章 基本概念与模型

角色与边界

云提供者

  • The organization that provides cloud-based IT resources.

    提供基于云的 IT资源的组织机构。

    Be responsible for making cloud services available to cloud consumers as per agreed upon SLA guaranteesEnsure the on-going operation of the

    overall cloud infrastructure own or resell IT resources

云用户

  • Cloud consumer is an organization (or a human) that has a formal contract or arrangement with a cloud provider to use IT resources made available by the cloud provider. Specifically, the cloud consumer uses a cloud service consumer to access a cloud service.

    云用户是组织机构（或者人），他们与云提供者签订正式的合同或者约定来使用云提供者提供的可用的 IT 资源。具体来说，云用户使用云服务用户来访问云服务。

云服务拥有者

  • The person or organization that legally owns a cloud service.

    在法律上拥有云服务的个人或者组织。

云资源管理者

  • Person or organization responsible for administering a cloud-based IT resource (including cloud services).

    负责管理基于云的 IT 资源（包括云服务）

其他角色

  • Cloud Auditor 云审计–对云环境进行独立评估的第三方（通常通过认证的）。
  • Cloud Broker 云代理–承担管理和协商云用户和云提供者之间云服务使用的责任。
  • Cloud Carrier 云运营商–负责提供云用户和云提供者之间的线路级连接（这个角色通常由网络和电信提供商担任）。

组织边界

  • Represents the physical perimeter that surrounds a set of IT resources that are owned and governed by an organization.

    代表一个组织拥有和管理的 IT 资源的物理范围。

信任边界

  • A logical perimeter that typically spans beyond physical boundaries to represent the extent to which IT resources are trusted.

    一个逻辑范围，包括一个组织信任的 IT 资源。

云特性

六大特性

  • 按需使用 on-demand usage
  • 随处访问 ubiquitous access
  • 多租户（和资源池）resource pool
  • 弹性 elasticity
  • 可测量的使用 measured usage
  • 可恢复性 resiliency（NIST云计算定义不包括此性质）

云交付模型

基础设施作为服务（IaaS）

  • The IaaS delivery model represents a self-contained IT environment comprised of infrastructure-centric IT resources that can be accessed and managed via cloud service-based interfaces and tools.
  • This environment can include hardware, network, connectivity，operating systems，and other “raw” （原始的）IT resources.
  • The general purpose of an IaaS environment is to provide cloud consumers with a high level of control and responsibility over its configuration（配置） and utilization（使用）.
  • The IT resources provided by IaaS are generally not pre-configured（未配置 ）, placing the administrative responsibility directly upon the cloud consumer.
  • This model is therefore used by cloud consumers that require a high level of control （高控制权）over the cloud-based environment they intend to create.

平台作为服务（PaaS）

  • The PaaS delivery model represents a pre-defined “ready-to-use（就绪可用）” environment typically comprised of already deployed（部署） and configured（配置） IT resources.

    PaaS 交付模型是预先定义好的“就绪可用”的环境，一般由已经部署好和配置好的 IT 资源组成。

软件作为服务（SaaS）

  • A software program positioned as a shared cloud service and made available as a “product” or generic utility（通用工具） represents the typical profile of a SaaS offering.

    SaaS 通常是把软件程序定位成共享的云服务，作为“产品”或通用的工具进行提供。

  • Be typically used to make a reusable（可重用的） cloud service widely available （often commercially） to a range of cloud consumers.

云交付模型比较

A comparison of typical cloud delivery model control levels.

云部署模型

公有云

  • A publicly accessible cloud environment owned by a third-party cloud provider.
  • The cloud provider is responsible for the creation and on-going （不间断的） maintenance of the public cloud and its IT resources.

社区云

  • A community cloud is similar to a public cloud except that its access is limited to a specific community of cloud consumers.

  • Membership in the community does not necessarily guarantee access to or control of all the cloud’s IT resources. Parties outside the community are generally not granted access unless allowed by the community.

私有云

  • A private cloud is owned by a single organization.
    • a separate(单独的) organizational department typically assumes the responsibility for provisioning the cloud (and therefore assumes the cloud provider role)
    • departments requiring access to the private cloud assume the cloud consumer role

混合云

  • A hybrid cloud is a cloud environment comprised of two or more different cloud deployment models.

其他云部署模型

  • Virtual Private Cloud 虚拟私有云

    • –or dedicated cloud（专有云）
    • –or hosted cloud（托管云）
    • 仅对一个云用户可用

  • Inter-Cloud 互联云

entry.title: 第3章 理解云计算
entry.content:
第3章 理解云计算

起源与影响

简要历史

  • 1961年，John McCarthy 公开提出“效用计算”（utility computing）。
  • 1969年， Leonard Kleinrock 在 ARPANET 项目中表示“计算机应用的扩展”（spread of computer utilities）。
  • 20世纪90年代中期，普通大众开始以各种形式使用基于 Internet 的计算机应用（internet-based computer utilities）。
  • 20世纪90年代后期，Salesforce.com 率先在企业中引入“远程提供服务”的概念（remotely provisioned services）。
  • 2002年，Amazon.com 启用 Amazon Web 服务（Amazon Web Service，AWS）平台。
  • 2006年，“云计算”（cloud computing）这一术语出现在商业领域。
  • 2009年，Google 应用引擎（Google App Engine）成为了另一个里程碑。

定义

  • Gartner （高德纳咨询公司）定义（了解）：

    a style of computing in which scalable and elastic IT-enabled capabilities are delivered as a service to external customers using Internet technologies.

    一种能通过Internet技术将可扩展性和弹性的IT能力作为服务交付给外部用户的计算方式。

  • Forrester Research （弗雷斯特研究公司）定义（了解）：

    a standardized IT capability (services, software, or infrastructure) delivered via Internet technologies in a pay-per-use, self-service way.

    一种标准化的IT性能（服务、软件或者基础设施），按使用付费和自助服务方式，通过Internet技术进行交付。

  • 美国国家标准与技术研究院（NIST）制定（2011年9月 修订版）：

    Cloud computing is a model for enabling ubiquitous, convenient, on-demand network access to a shared pool of configurable computing resources (e.g. networks, servers, storage, applications, and services) that can be rapidly provisioned and released with minimal management effort or service provider interaction. This cloud model is composed of five essential characteristics, three service models, and four deployment models.

    云计算是一种模型，可以实现随时随地、便携地、按需地从可配置计算资源共享池中获取所需的资源（例如，网络、服务器、存储、应用程序及服务），资源可以快速供给和释放，只需提供很少的管理工作，或与服务提供者进行很少的交互。这种云模型由五个基本特征、三种服务模型和四种部署模型构成。

  • 云计算的基本特征：

    1. ubiquitous access 随处访问
    2. on-demand usage 按需使用
    3. measured usage 可测量的使用
    4. resource pool 资源池
    5. elasticity 弹性

  • 本书给出了云计算更为简洁的定义：

    Cloud computing is a specialized form of distributed computing that introduces utilization models for remotely provisioning scalable and measured resources.

    云计算是分布式计算的一种特殊形式，它引入效用模型来远程供给可扩展和可测量的资源。

基本概念与术语

云

  • A cloud refers to a distinct IT environment that is designed for the purpose of remotely provisioning scalable and measured IT resources.

    云是指一个独特的IT环境，设计目的是为了远程供给可扩展和可测量的IT资源。

IT 资源

  • An IT resource is a physical or virtual IT-related artifact that can be either software-based, such as a virtual server or a custom software program, or hardware-based, such as a physical server or a network device.

    IT 资源是指一个与 IT 相关的物理的或虚拟的事物，它既可以是基于软件的（虚拟服务器或定制软件程序），也可以是基于硬件的（物理服务器或网络设备）。

企业内部的

  • An IT resource that is hosted in a conventional IT enterprise within an organizational boundary that does not specifically represent a cloud is considered to be located on the premises of the IT enterprise, or on-premise for short.

    处于一个组织边界中的传统 IT 企业内部承载的IT资源被认为是位于 IT 企业内部的

  • An IT resource that is on-premise cannot be cloud-based, and vice-versa.

    一个内部的 IT 资源不可能是基于云的，反之亦然。

  • 有三点需要注意：

    1. An on-premise IT resource can access and interact with a cloud-based IT resource.

      一个内部的 IT 资源可以访问一个基于云的 IT 资源，并与之交互。

    2. An on-premise IT resource can be moved to a cloud, thereby changing it to a cloud-based IT resource.

      一个内部的 IT 资源可以迁移到云中，从而成为一个基于云的 IT 资源。

    3. Redundant deployments of an IT resource can exist in both on-premise and cloud-based environments.

      IT 资源既可以冗余部署在企业内部，也可以在云环境中。

云用户与云提供者

  • The party that provides cloud-based IT resources is the cloud provider.

    提供基于云的 IT 资源的一方称为云提供者。

  • The party that uses cloud-based IT resources is the cloud consumer.

    使用基于云的 IT 资源的一方称为云用户。

可扩展性

  • From an IT resource perspective, scaling represents the ability of the IT resource to handle increased or decreased usage demands.

    可扩展性是指 IT 资源可以处理增加或减少的使用需求的能力。

  • 可扩展性有两种类型：

    1. Horizontal Scaling – scaling out and scaling in 水平扩展
    2. Vertical Scaling – scaling up and scaling down 垂直扩展

云服务

  • A cloud service is any IT resource that is made remotely accessible via a cloud.

    云服务是指任何可以通过云远程访问的 IT 资源。

云服务用户

  • The cloud service consumer is a temporary runtime role assumed by a software program when it accesses a cloud service.

    云服务用户是一个临时的运行时角色，由访问云服务的软件程序担任。
